NXC App Docker Setup

This repository includes a Docker Compose configuration for the NXC App, comprising a backend application (nxc_app) and a MySQL database (nxc_db).

Prerequisites:

  • Docker installed on your machine.
  • Basic knowledge of Docker Compose.

Usage:

  1. Clone this repository:
    • git clone <repository-url>
    • cd <repository-directory>
  2. Build and run Docker containers:
    • docker-compose up --build
  3. Access NXC App at http://[ip-address]:80.

Container Details:

nxc_app:

  • Container Name: nxc_be
  • Port Mapping: Host 80 to Container 80
  • Environment: ASPNETCORE_ENVIRONMENT=Development
  • Healthcheck: curl -f http://[ip-address]//health
  • Restart Policy: Always

nxc_db:

  • Image: mysql:latest
  • Container Name: nxc_database
  • Port Mapping: Host 3306 to Container 3306
  • Environment:
    • MYSQL_DATABASE: nxcapp
    • MYSQL_USER: nxc_dbuser
    • MYSQL_PASSWORD: 123456
    • MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD: root
  • Volumes:
    • nxc_db_data for persistent data
    • Initialization script: ./Database/nxc-database-11302023.sql | Note: this entry-db can be change if have update database

Networks:

  • mynetwork: Docker bridge network for container communication.

Volumes:

  • nxc_db_data: Docker volume for MySQL data persistence.
